00038 /*NOTE: this is the bmesh 1.0 code.  it's completely outdated.*/

00040 /* uncomment to use the new bevel operator as a modifier */
00041 // #define USE_BM_BEVEL_OP_AS_MOD
00042 
00043 /* bevel tool defines */
00044 /* element flags */
00045 #define BME_BEVEL_ORIG          1
00046 #define BME_BEVEL_BEVEL         (1<<1)
00047 #define BME_BEVEL_NONMAN        (1<<2)
00048 #define BME_BEVEL_WIRE          (1<<3)
00049 
00050 /* tool options */
00051 #define BME_BEVEL_SELECT        1
00052 #define BME_BEVEL_VERT          (1<<1)
00053 #define BME_BEVEL_RADIUS        (1<<2)
00054 #define BME_BEVEL_ANGLE         (1<<3)
00055 #define BME_BEVEL_WEIGHT        (1<<4)
00056 //~ #define BME_BEVEL_EWEIGHT       (1<<4)
00057 //~ #define BME_BEVEL_VWEIGHT       (1<<5)
00058 #define BME_BEVEL_PERCENT       (1<<6)
00059 #define BME_BEVEL_EMIN          (1<<7)
00060 #define BME_BEVEL_EMAX          (1<<8)
00061 #define BME_BEVEL_RUNNING       (1<<9)
00062 #define BME_BEVEL_RES           (1<<10)
00063 
00064 #define BME_BEVEL_EVEN          (1<<11) /* this is a new setting not related to old (trunk bmesh bevel code) but adding
00065                                          * here because they are mixed - campbell */
00066 #define BME_BEVEL_DIST          (1<<12) /* same as above */
00067 
00068 typedef struct BME_TransData {
00069     struct BMesh *bm; /* the bmesh the vert belongs to */
00070     struct BMVert *v;  /* pointer to the vert this tdata applies to */
00071     float co[3];  /* the original coordinate */
00072     float org[3]; /* the origin */
00073     float vec[3]; /* a directional vector; always, always normalize! */
00074     void *loc;    /* a pointer to the data to transform (likely the vert's cos) */
00075     float factor; /* primary scaling factor; also accumulates number of weighted edges for beveling tool */
00076     float weight; /* another scaling factor; used primarily for propogating vertex weights to transforms; */
00077                   /* weight is also used across recursive bevels to help with the math */
00078     float maxfactor; /* the unscaled, original factor (used only by "edge verts" in recursive beveling) */
00079     float *max;   /* the maximum distance this vert can be transformed; negative is infinite
00080                    * it points to the "parent" maxfactor (where maxfactor makes little sense)
00081                    * where the max limit is stored (limits are stored per-corner) */
00082 } BME_TransData;
00083 
00084 typedef struct BME_TransData_Head {
00085     struct GHash *gh;       /* the hash structure for element lookup */
00086     struct MemArena *ma;    /* the memory "pool" we will be drawing individual elements from */
00087     int len;
00088 } BME_TransData_Head;
00089 
00090 /* this is no longer used */
00091 typedef struct BME_Glob { /* stored in Global G for Transform() purposes */
00092     struct BMesh *bm;
00093     BME_TransData_Head *td;
00094     struct TransInfo *Trans; /* a pointer to the global Trans struct */
00095     int imval[2]; /* for restoring original mouse co when initTransform() is called multiple times */
00096     int options;
00097     int res;
00098 } BME_Glob;
00099 
00100 struct BME_TransData *BME_get_transdata(struct BME_TransData_Head *td, struct BMVert *v);
00101 void BME_free_transdata(struct BME_TransData_Head *td);
00102 struct BMesh *BME_bevel(struct BMEditMesh *em, float value, int res, int options, int defgrp_index, float angle,
00103                         BME_TransData_Head **rtd, int do_tessface);
